supporting.text: Donald Trump was born in Queens, New York, which is part of the United States, making him an American by birthright.

attacks.text: Donald Trump was born in Queens, New York, which is part of the United States, making him an American by birthright.
Birthright citizenship is not universally recognized, and some legal scholars argue it should not apply to children of non-citizen parents.
The 14th Amendment of the U.S. Constitution explicitly grants birthright citizenship regardless of parental citizenship status, making this argument legally invalid.
There are fringe conspiracy theories claiming Donald Trump was born outside the U.S., which would negate his birthright citizenship.
All credible evidence, including his birth certificate, confirms Donald Trump was born in New York, rendering conspiracy theories baseless.

supporting.text: Donald Trump holds U.S. citizenship, which legally qualifies him as an American.

attacks.text: Donald Trump holds U.S. citizenship, which legally qualifies him as an American.
U.S. citizenship does not necessarily equate to being culturally or ideologically American, as identity is multifaceted.
Legal definitions of nationality are the primary standard for determining who is American, regardless of cultural or ideological alignment.
Some argue that birthright citizenship is insufficient to confer true 'American' status if the individual does not uphold democratic values.
The U.S. Constitution explicitly defines citizenship by birth or naturalization, making subjective criteria like 'upholding values' legally irrelevant.

supporting.text: Donald Trump served as the 45th President of the United States, a position reserved for American citizens.

attacks.text: Donald Trump served as the 45th President of the United States, a position reserved for American citizens.
The U.S. Constitution does not explicitly require the President to be a natural-born citizen, only a citizen at the time of the Constitution's adoption.

The Natural Born Citizen Clause in Article II, Section 1, Clause 5 of the U.S. Constitution requires the President to be a natural-born citizen, which includes being born in the U.S. or to U.S. citizen parents abroad.
There is no publicly available birth certificate proving Donald Trump was born in the United States.
Donald Trump's birth certificate was released in 2011, showing he was born in New York City, confirming his U.S. citizenship.

supporting.text: Donald Trump's parents were both U.S. citizens at the time of his birth, further confirming his American nationality.

attacks.text: Donald Trump's parents were both U.S. citizens at the time of his birth, further confirming his American nationality.
Birthright citizenship has been historically contested, and some legal scholars argue it should not apply to children of non-resident citizens.
The 14th Amendment explicitly guarantees citizenship to all persons born in the U.S., regardless of parental status, and this has been upheld by Supreme Court precedent.
If Donald Trump was born outside the U.S., his parents' citizenship alone would not automatically grant him birthright citizenship.
Historical records and birth certificates confirm Donald Trump was born in New York, making him a natural-born U.S. citizen regardless of his parents' status.
